title: For Sale:  COLT MATCH TARGET LIGHTWEIGHT MT6530 WITH EXTRAS...ASKING $800
postcontent:
I am selling a Colt AR-style Match Target (MT6530) Lightweight semi-automatic rifle. I am the original owner of this rifle and can say that the performance has been outstanding. I've probably put 500 rounds through the barrel (16" 1/7 right hand twist). It has very light wear and has been babied the whole time I've owned it. The sights are standard M-16A2 sights (front sight post, rear sight aperture).

I have made some modifications from the original rifle (seen here http://www.gunsamerica.com/UserImages/91381/913591447/wm_1077238.jpg)

-replaced the original A2 fixed stock with a 4-position collapsible stock
-replaced the original hand guards with a Knights Armament picatinny-rail hand guards
-added a removable picatinny-rail on top of the A2 carrying handle
-replaced the original buffer base plate with one that allows a sling to be attached

Included with this rifle is a quick-release hands free tactical sling, the original 9-round magazine that came with it, five 20-round PMAGs, and the user manual.

Very good rifle!

title: For Sale:  Smith & Wesson M&P15 in 5.45x39 with Ammunition and Accessories
postcontent:
I have a S&W MP15 chambered in 5.45x39, a Russian Surplus round originally designed for the AK-74, meant to replace the heavier 7.62x39 round. It didn't really catch on, and now we have access to a ton of cheap ammunition.

You Get:
The Rifle. ($895) I'm the only owner. ~800 rounds through the gun, total. Nail driver. Has forward assist, top rail, front gas-block sight and an A2 style back site ($25). 

1181 Rounds of 5.45x39 ammo. 1080 are still sealed in the 'spam can.' ($200+)

3, 30 Round magazines. One is original, made by CProducts. The other 2 are also CProducts mags, but need some adjustment to feel well. Online, some guys say that it just needs a touch of Dremeling, but I n ever bothered with it; just loaded those with 15rounds rather than 30. ($40)

"Tactical" bag. One main gun area with velcro straps, one storage area, 3 Molle style pouches on the front. Carry handles and rings for a carry strap. ($65)

Sling - Winchester One Point sling. Needs one point ring (cheap). Has regular sling rings on it, as well. ($20)

Original plastic/foam case. (Priceless)

All said, this gun and the stuff with it works to about $1400 after taxes and FFL Fees.  Cheapest on gun broker is the gun+1080 rounds for $1295+shipping/FFL. I need new toys, so I'm looking for a quick sale. Save some cash and some hassle. 

*The image is a stock image. Your gun will come with the back A2 Style Sight.

title: For Sale:  Anti-Personnel 44 Mag. Ammo - 180 gr. Medium Cast HP-GC (1,550 fps) - 20 Round Box
postcontent:
http://extreme-impact-ammo.com/index.php?l=product_detail&p=243

These Anti-Personnel 44 magnum loads were designed for the owners of 44 magnum firearms that choose to use those firearms for defense against humans. Both loads feature light weight, hollow nosed bullets, designed to mushroom dramatically at the intended impact velocities. Item # 4H will perform on humans much like our DEER GRENADE load (Item # 4F) performs on game animals. The light-for-caliber weight of these bullets, aids in reduced felt recoil, for faster follow-up shots. We've employed flash suppressed powders but, with any bullet moving this fast from typical length revolvers, there is still a decent flash in low light.

Both of these loads will also work well on light, big game such as whitetail deer.

Both of these loads are safe to use in ALL/ANY 44 mag. firearm that is in normal operating condition.

Note our real world velocities taken from my personal stock firearms. We prefer to establish our advertised velocities from over-the-counter, stock firearms, while most ammunition companies establish their published velocities from laboratory, long, test barrels, which provide false or exaggeratedly high readings. We feel that this long established practice does not give the customer a true idea of what the ammunition is doing when fired from 'real world guns' under 'real world conditions,' where these numbers really do matter.

title: For Sale:  Spanish FR-8 (Mauser) .308 cal
postcontent:
1948 Model Spanish FR-8 Mauser In Great Shape has some dings and dent in the wood from Use by the Army. Rifle comes with the original sling, and a Bayonet 40 rounds of military .308 and 25 rounds of .308 tracer rounds. Bore is in excellent shape! 
The flash hider was designed to be compatible with NATO-standard rifle grenades. 

History: The FR-8 was introduced in 1950 using left over Mauser parts after WWII came to a close and this gem lasted into the 1970's before being retired in favor of the need for an assault Rifle. The FR-8's were side lined as target / training rifles. The sights clearly show this and it is vary accurate. The rear sight is an elevation-adjustable rotary type with aperatures for 200 m (220 yd), 300 m (330 yd) and 400 m (440 yd), as well as an open "V" notch for 100 metres (110 yd). The front sight is elevation-adjustable via a special tool. Operation is identical to the standard Mauser design.

I have shot this At a range of 200 yards with iron sights the rounds are about 1 -2 inches off bulls eye but other wise she's a good rifle.

Imports on these rifles to the U.S. stopped about 18 years ago so this is a rare bird so to say in the U.S. Only serous collectors please Cash Only Local pick up in the Tulsa area. More photos can be taken and sent on request.

I can do two things local pick up or if you live out of state contact me and maybe we'll see what can be made in arraignments to have this shipped to you only after payment has arrived in the form of a U.S. Money Order. I do not own or run a gun shop so FFL transfer Fees will have to be at your expense (sorry)

Winchester 1892 Large Loop Lever action rifle, like new, made in 2012

Have box / paperwork
400 rounds cowboy ammunition. Will not separate. 
Interested parties respond to link. Leave contact info and i will get back with you. 
You know you always wanted one! 


News Release -- The distinctive look of the Winchester 1892 large loop carbine rifle was the dream of many young boys and old men who watched the gun being used on TV shows and in movies 50 years ago.   Watching their favorite actor handle the rifle with one hand was the envy of every want-to- be cowboy.

Winchester Repeating Arms is helping make those dreams come true with the introduction of the 1892 Large Loop Carbine back in to their rifle line for 2012.  The new rifle looks just like the original 1892 with a 20-inch button-rifled barrel and overall length of 37 ½ inches.   It features a Grade 1 walnut stock with a rich, satin finish.  The steel contoured carbine strap buttplate is quick to shoulder and protects the buttstock from damage. 

The new 1892 also features a Marble Arms front sight with brass bead and an adjustable rear sight.   The full length magazine holds 10 cartridges and the rifle is available in 4 calibers: 357 Mag., 44 Rem Mag., 44-40 Winchester and 45 Colt.   Each rifle comes with an eye-catching saddle ring.

However, the most distinguished feature of the rifle is the Large Loop Lever with radiused edges.   The lever makes it easy to cycle the rife, even with gloves on.   The 1892 will be produced in limited quantities so interested buyers need to contact their Winchester Repeating Arms dealer soon.

Suggested Retail, $1,259.99

title: For Sale/Trade:  Home defense, range, carry, and bug out gun.
postcontent:
Hardly used Beretta 92A1. Improved design over the FS. Improved internals for recoil reduction, better handling of +p rounds, much better sights, better frame design, added accessory rail, and all the internals have a polymer coating, to resist rust, and sand.

Feel free to double check my math.
Gunbroker, GunsAmerica, and other related sites have this gun used for an average of $575, plus FFL and background fees, so $625.
 New is closer to $600, plus shipping, plus FFL transfer, plus background check. So closer to $660.

I'm just writing down my thought processes, so you can see my logic.
$580 for the pistol, and the 3 "safe capacity" magazine kits that it comes with.
$17ea for the 5x15 round magazines I have. $85 (They go for $25 new, these are used, in good condition.)
A box and a half of FMJ ammo. $20 or so.
20 rounds of Win PDX1. $25.
Hogue grip, and original grip. $15.
Used TLR-1 tactical light $75. ($150 new on Impactguns.)

Comes out to $800.
Has had half a box of ammo through it. Was cleaned, then put away.

title: For Sale:  One of a kind, Top of the line, custom AR15
postcontent:
Up for sale is the Finest one of a kind AR you will ever find. This coming from a guy that has owned ALL the best stuff out there including Noveske, LWRC, LaRue, DD, Barrett, HK, etc… I promise you this will out perform any of the other manufacturers finest weapons! It has a long stroke variable setting gas piston system(eliminates all carrier tilt issues found in other short stroke piston systems), dual recoil spring system for minimal recoil and barrel flip. It has 5 adjustable gas settings. Very handy if you plan on running suppressed. The upper receiver has an interchangeable barrel system in which you can buy the 300 Blackout barrel kit to install easily without the need for a gunsmith.Literally 6 allen screws and the barrel pops right out! All calibers come in multiple length barrels also. Faxon has multiple caliber barrels coming out this year!
The 300 is already available. 308, 22LR, 5.45, and 7.62 are on the way.
It also has a non-reciprocating charging handle and you have the option to switch it to either side.
forward left like an MP5…..
A special feature with this upper is that it can be fired without a buffer tube, thus you can fire this with a folding stock or without one as a pistol; its quite versatile.

Below is a break down of everything in the build. I have the boxes, paperwork, and receipts for every item. The Faxon upper and Vortex optic also have a lifetime, no questions asked, warranty! Talk about peace of mind!

title: For Sale:  Mosin Nagant M44 Carbine
postcontent:
FS: Russian manufactured M44 Mosin Nagant carbine with sling as pictured this rifle is chambered in 7.62x54 and most stores have this ammo on the shelf. This is the shorter rifle not the long version you see in the movies. This wasn't meant to be a "sniper rifle" and has no provision for optics. It was however manufactured half a century ago. postcontent:
Detailed pictures: http://imgur.com/2lSDYDL,Rv0ayNJ,oJepDdE,0Jz3Vog,LNyfo9L#3

This advertisement is for a 1944 SAKO M39 chambered in 7.62x54r. This rifle is one of the relatively few unrefurbished M39s of its vintage to be imported to the US and has 99-100% original SAKO factory finish on the metal.

The bore is dirty, but appears to be in very good condition aside from needing a thorough cleaning.

The rifle is in good working order and has no known issues.

The stock is a correct wartime stock with shims. There is a surface split on the side of the buttstock from the oil drying out in storage, but it doesn't extend under the buttplate.

The receiver and most of the bolt are captured Tula (I don't remember the year of the receiver, sorry), but the bolt connector prominently wears the circle "R" Remington proof, while the cocking piece is stamped with the SAKO gear.

Original cleaning rod and sling are included.

title: For Sale:  Custom AR-15
postcontent:
Hi, I have a custom AR15 i'm putting up for sale. here are the specs:
16 inch chrome hammer forged lightweight barrel made by FN with 1 in 7 twist
Spikes tactical spider lower reciever w/ colored safety selector
rifle length YHM Diamond quad rail
PWS 556 muzzle brake
Telescopic leg tension lock bipod
Magpul MOE Handguard
Magpul MOE grip
Magpul MOE Rifle stock w/ internal storage compartment
Bugbuster 3x-9 rifle scope with illumintaed red/green crosshairs, target turrets, and flip up cover on quick detach picatinny mounts.
45 degree iron sights for ease of use with rifle scope
Magpul Bad Lever


The gun is set up well. The FSC comp keeps recoil very mild for an ar-15, and the rifle length buffer system helps as well. The scope is precise and has more than enough eye relief and is adjustable for parallax as close as ten feet away. I have these on multiple guns and they work very well. The scope sits on a riser for a good cheek weld to the stock. The 45 degree iron sights allow the user to use iron sites without removing the scope. The pistol grip provides very good grip on the gun and has internal storage, as does the stock. I have shot 160 rounds through the gun with no failures of any kind, and once sighted in the gun was grouping about an inch at 100 yards, and very very tight at 50 with groups covered by a quarter using cheap pmc brass cased 55gr and the bipod. The gun recoils very little, and impact can be observed through the scope. The FN Herstal barrel is cold hammer forged and lightweight, and the yhm diamond quad rail is very good quality, and I added an endcap as well. The lower receiver was assembled from parts by a licensed professional gunsmith about 4 months ago, and all parts were purchased new for the build. title: For Sale:  Slide Fire SSAR-15 SBS Right Handed
postcontent:
100% Legal to own and use!

Includes:
SSAR-15 SBS Stock
Interface Block, Nut Retainer.
Hex Key.
Mounting Hardware.
Instructions (found on the product packaging).

Fitment:
Only compatible with AR-15's with a collapsible stock (add the conversion kit if you have a fixed stock AR-15).

Compatible with Mil-Spec and Commercial Buffer Tubes.

Some Sling Plates may not be compatible.

Some of the aftermarket "billet" receivers have non-standard dimensions and therefore may not be compatible.

100% Legal to own and use!

Slide Fire Solutions' ground breaking "Slide Fire Stock" technology and ergonomic design provide individuals the ability to bump fire more safely, offering another element of entertainment for recreational shooters everywhere! You can now safely and accurately bump-fire your AR-15 at an incredible rate. Each SSAR-15 comes with a Hex Key to remove the factory pistol grip, Interface Block, SSAR-15 Rifle Stock, and Installation / Operation Instructions. Every SSAR-15 stock has a Lifetime Warranty from the manufacturer covering defects in materials and workmanship.

Applying principles that have been used for over 40 years to Bump Fire, this new radical design ensures the operator can hold the rifle correctly without compromising their own safety or the safety of others around them. Unlike when bump firing from the hip; the SSAR-15 allows the shooter to properly aim the rifle. In addition, the shooter must push forward to discharge each round, as a result, the shooter corrects their point-of-aim for each shot discharged instead of allowing recoil to push the muzzle upward.

The primary difference between the SSAR-15 SBS™ and the SSAR-15 OGR™ is the design intent. In an effort to cater to varying consumer preferences, the SSAR-15 SBS™ is designed to resemble current combat rifle stocks. In addition, the SSAR-15 SBS™ was designed with multiple accessories in mind which will be available in the near future.
